entry.title: WINTER STORM WARNING, Mary's Harbour
entry.summary: Persons in or near this area should be on the lookout for adverse weather conditions and take necessary safety precautions. Issued: 10:25 p.m. ADT Sunday 2 April 2023

entry.title: Current Conditions: Cloudy, -1.7Â°C
entry.summary:
Observed at: Mary's Harbour 3:30 AM NDT Monday 3 April 2023
Condition: Cloudy
Temperature: -1.7°C
Pressure: 98.5 kPa
Visibility: 16 km
Humidity: 94 %
Wind Chill: -5
Dewpoint: -2.5°C

Air Quality Health Index: n/a

entry.title: Sunday night: Snow and blowing snow. Low minus 2.
entry.summary: Snow ending before morning then mainly cloudy. Blowing snow overnight. Amount 5 cm except 15 cm north of Port Hope Simpson. Wind east 30 km/h gusting to 50 becoming southwest 20 gusting to 40 this evening then north 40 gusting to 60 after midnight. Low minus 2. Wind chill minus 10 overnight. Forecast issued 4:30 PM NDT Sunday 2 April 2023

entry.title: Monday: Chance of flurries. High plus 2. POP 60%
entry.summary: A mix of sun and cloud. 60 percent chance of flurries in the morning. Blowing snow over exposed areas in the morning. Wind northwest 40 km/h gusting to 60. High plus 2. Wind chill minus 10 in the morning. UV index 4 or moderate. Forecast issued 4:30 PM NDT Sunday 2 April 2023

entry.title: Monday night: A few clouds. Low minus 9.
entry.summary: A few clouds. Wind northwest 30 km/h gusting to 50 becoming west 20 gusting to 40 near midnight. Low minus 9. Wind chill minus 17 overnight. Forecast issued 4:30 PM NDT Sunday 2 April 2023
